case_vignette: A 26-year-old male professional soccer player is brought to the emergency department due to an episode of syncope during a game. He has felt increasing shortness of breath during the past 3 months. During the past week, he has been feeling chest pain upon exertion. He also tells the doctor that his brother had a sudden death a couple of years ago. His heart rate is 98/min, respiratory rate is 18/min, temperature is 36.5°C (97.7°F), and blood pressure is 110/72 mm Hg. On physical examination, there is a harsh crescendo-decrescendo systolic murmur immediately after S1; it is best heard on the apex, and it radiates to the axilla. There is also an early diastolic murmur heard in early diastole, which is best heard with the bell of the stethoscope. When the Valsalva maneuver is performed, the murmur becomes louder. An ECG and an echocardiogram are performed, which confirm the diagnosis.
question: What is the most likely cause of this patient’s condition?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I passed out during a soccer game, have been getting out of breath for the past 3 months, and have been having chest pain when I do physical activities over the last week.
How old are you?
I'm 26 years old.
Do you have any personal or family history of heart disease?
Yes, my brother suddenly passed away a couple of years ago.
Do you currently take any medications for any medical condition? Or have you ever been diagnosed with any heart condition in the past?
No, I am not taking any medications and have not been diagnosed with any heart condition in the past.
Do you have any other symptoms such as swelling in your feet or ankles, or difficulty lying flat due to shortness of breath?
No, I haven't noticed any swelling in my feet or ankles, nor do I have difficulty lying flat because of shortness of breath.
**Final Diagnosis:** Cardiomyopathy
